author: GamingBolt
description:
For $40, the content that Renegades lacks, no Strikes or Crucible maps, only one Exotic gear piece per class, no new region (unless you count Tharsis Outpost, which you shouldn't), cuts a little too deep. I probably wouldn't mind it so much if there were tons of fresh ideas, instead, a good portion feels very “Been there, done that," except those times had better characters and mission design.

If The Edge of Fate dissuaded you from ever engaging with Destiny 2 again, then Renegades is at least worth a try. It may pleasantly surprise the most jaded fans, offer some enjoyable loot for the most hardcore, and maybe remind you of the good times in the Star Wars universe. While never meant to be this giant momentum shift for the franchise that would finally steer it in the right direction, I find myself, as always, yearning for more.
title: Destiny 2 Renegades DLC Review - The Final Verdict

author: GamingBolt
description:
Since the hovering view over Fjord-like territories announced Skyrim’s follow-up at E3 2018, Bethesda has offered almost nothing concrete about The Elder Scrolls VI. No trailer, no confirmed setting, not even a pixel of concept art. For a series whose influence imbues every modern-day RPG, their silence only intensifies the notion this game is forever out of reach.

In the past few months, however, Todd Howard has been progressively opening the curtain, offering tiny glimpses of Bethesda’s internal mindset. And despite talking more about other projects, he’s given something resembling clarity for The Elder Scrolls VI’s expectant fans.
title: The Elder Scrolls 6 - What The Hell Is Even Going On?

author: GamingBolt
description:
2025 delivered a packed lineup of games that fully leverage the PS5's strengths. The games on this list deliver instant load times, smooth performance, rich DualSense integration, and stunning visual fidelity. More importantly, 2025 showcased the breadth of what PlayStation’s ecosystem can offer: daring horror, inventive RPGs, emotional journeys, and genre-defining action experiences. 

Together, these games paint a picture of a platform with a complete set of games in its roster, and of a year that set a new standard for what PS5 exclusives and third-party releases can achieve.
title: 16 Best PS5 Games of 2025
